definition: suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it

sentences.english: Patty minded his ridiculing less when her mother was the butt of it.
sentences.chinese: 如果她爸的嘲笑对象是她妈，帕蒂就不怎么介意了。

sentences.english: Not very nice , goof lens and more.
sentences.chinese: 不怎么好看，穿帮镜头多。

sentences.english: It didn't look very modern; the houses were huge and old looking.
sentences.chinese: 那看起来不怎么现代，房子很大很古旧。

sentences.english: but with, you know, less cost, and probably even quality is not that high.
sentences.chinese: 却只要更少的成本，虽然产品的质量可能不怎么高。

sentences.english: It’s not appropriate to leave queues of taxpayers and go for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 放下排长队的纳税人去吃午饭这实在是不怎么合适。

sentences.english: "We hardly get sick at all, " Mrs McKamey says hopefully.
sentences.chinese: “我们根本不怎么得病，”麦克康美太太自我安慰说。

sentences.english: I don't think Linda appreciated my wisecracks .
sentences.chinese: 我看琳达好像不怎么喜欢我的俏皮话。

sentences.english: Some people think that coasting is less fuel-efficient because it takes up fuel to start up the engine.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为滑行并不怎么省油，因为启动引擎耗油。

sentences.english: He said such views could cause them 'not to care much about the dead babies.'
sentences.chinese: 他说，这样的观念可能使他们对死婴不怎么关心。

sentences.english: I don't normally blame anything on the refs.
They were not welcomed home very  cordially by their mother.
sentences.chinese: 到家以后，母亲并不怎么热诚地欢迎她们。

sentences.english: They achieve clarity when they are faced with two not-great options.
sentences.chinese: 面对两个都不怎么样的选择，他们的想法会清晰起来。

sentences.english: Things like a two-year non-compete clause don't work well in China.
sentences.chinese: 有关两年内非竞争条款在中国并不怎么适用。

sentences.english: He sings terribly, out of tune now and then, but I still have to applaud.
sentences.chinese: 他唱得真不怎么样，经常走调，不过我还得鼓掌叫好。

sentences.english: I think I have heard that Mr Bingley has not much idea of ever returning to Netherfield again?
sentences.chinese: 我想我听说过，彬格莱先生不怎么打算再回尼日斐了？

sentences.english: It must work better for Chinese than it does for foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 促销员对中国人更有用，外国人不怎么有用。

definition: straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
to be unable to say or tell/to not be worth mentioning
